resource.description: The NCBI Taxonomy database contains the names of all organisms that are represented in the Entrez genetic databases.

The Sequence Ontology Project (SO) is a joint effort by genome annotation centres, including: WormBase, the Berkeley Drosophila Genome Project, FlyBase, the Mouse Genome Informatics group, and the Sanger Institute. They are a part of the Gene Ontology Project and their aim is to develop an ontology suitable for describing biological sequences.

resource.extDbRlsDescrip: Tparva Genomics WGS obtained from apidb@apiVersion@ downloads

resourcesPipeline.resource:
<manualGet fileOrDir="@manualDeliveryDir@/orphanOrgs/genomes/TparvaxGenome/T-parva-genome /> --tries=5 --externalDatabaseName %EXT_DB_NAME% --externalDatabaseVersion %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% --sequenceFile @downloadDir@/TparvaGenomics/T-parva-genome --SOTermName supercontig --ncbiTaxId 333668 --regexSourceId '>[^\|]+\|([^\|]+)\|' --regexDesc '>(?:[^\|]+\|){6}(.*)' --tableName 'DoTS::ExternalNASequence' --noCheck
Theileria parva strain Muguga Genomics WGS from ApiDB@apiVersion@ downloads.

resource.extDbRlsDescrip: Tannulata Genomics WGS obtained from apidb@apiVersion@ downloads

resourcesPipeline.resource:
<manualGet fileOrDir="@manualDeliveryDir@/orphanOrgs/genomes/TannulataGenome/T-annulata-genome /> --tries=5 --externalDatabaseName %EXT_DB_NAME% --externalDatabaseVersion %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% --sequenceFile @downloadDir@/TannulataGenomics/T-annulata-genome --SOTermName supercontig --ncbiTaxId 353154 --regexSourceId '>[^\|]+\|([^\|]+)\|' --regexDesc '>(?:[^\|]+\|){3}(.*)' --tableName 'DoTS::ExternalNASequence' --noCheck
Theileria annulata strain Ankara Genomics, WGS from ApiDB@apiVersion@ downloads.

resource.organisms: C.hominis, C.muris, C.parvum, G.lamblia, P.berghei, P.chabaudi, P.knowlesi, P.falciparum, P.vivax, P.yoelii, T.gondii, N.caninum, T.vaginalis,T.cruzi, T.brucei, L.braziliensis, L.infantum, L.major, T.annulata,T.parva
resource.description: OrthoMCL-based orthologous predictions for proteins were generated by Steve Fischer and Deborah Pinney (EuPathDB team) as described in Chen et al. Nucleic Acids Research 2006.
